primary_fields.name: Deal Name
primary_fields.description: The name of the deal, transaction, or agreement. Typically represents the title of the financial arrangement.
primary_fields.special_instructions: Look for capitalized words or phrases, often preceded by terms like 'Deal', Deal Name', 'Transaction', or 'Agreement'.

primary_fields.name: Requested Amount
primary_fields.description: The amount of money requested in the transaction, such as a loan or advance.
primary_fields.special_instructions: Look for monetary values (e.g., USD, EUR) preceded by terms like 'Requested', 'Loan', or 'Advance'.

primary_fields.name: Requested Currency
primary_fields.description: The currency in which the requested amount is denominated.
primary_fields.special_instructions: Look for currency codes (e.g., USD, EUR, GBP) or names (e.g., US Dollars, Euros) near the requested amount.

primary_fields.name: Lender Currency
primary_fields.description: The currency in which the lender is providing the funds.
primary_fields.special_instructions: Look for currency codes or names near phrases like 'Lender', 'Provided Currency', or 'Funding Currency'.

primary_fields.name: Lender Amount
primary_fields.description: The amount of money provided by the lender in the transaction.
primary_fields.special_instructions: Look for monetary values preceded by terms like 'Lender', 'Provided', or 'Funding'.

primary_fields.name: Effective Date
primary_fields.description: The date when the transaction or agreement becomes effective.
primary_fields.special_instructions: Look for date formats (e.g., DD-MM-YYYY, Month DD, YYYY) near terms like 'Effective', 'Start', or 'Commencement'.

primary_fields.name: Agent Bank
primary_fields.description: The name of the bank acting as the agent or managing bank in the transaction.
primary_fields.special_instructions: Look for organization names near terms like 'Agent Bank', 'Managing Bank', or 'Lead Institution'.

primary_fields.name: CUSIP
primary_fields.description: The unique identifier for financial instruments in the U.S., assigned by the Committee on Uniform Securities Identification Procedures.
primary_fields.special_instructions: Look for a 9-character alphanumeric code near terms like 'CUSIP' or 'Security Identifier'.

primary_fields.name: ISIN
primary_fields.description: The International Securities Identification Number, a unique identifier for financial instruments globally.
primary_fields.special_instructions: Look for a 12-character alphanumeric code near terms like 'ISIN' or 'International Security Identifier'.
